title: Understanding Bibliometric Analysis for Emergency Remote Teaching (ERT)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: A course analyzing and interpreting ERT (Emergency Remote Teaching) research trends in mathematics for adult learners using bibliometric methods. Conducted in an environment where digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided

learning_goals: Learners can classify ERT (Emergency Remote Teaching) research trends into three or more dimensions (year, country, topic) using bibliometric analysis methods.
Learners can generate and interpret keyword network maps related to ERT using VOSviewer tools.
Learners can apply PRISMA framework-based data collection procedures to mathematics education research cases.
Learners can derive three or more implications necessary for blended learning design based on analysis results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
